body:
Running with:
```csharp
            options.AppendExecutionProvider_CUDA(0);
            //options.AppendExecutionProvider_Tensorrt(0);
```
That is with CUDA instead of TensorRT shows that CUDA version also has a memory leak. While ~2 bytes is small this does accumulate in production too. 

``` ini

BenchmarkDotNet=v0.12.0, OS=Windows 10.0.17763.864 (1809/October2018Update/Redstone5)
Intel Core i7-8700 CPU 3.20GHz (Coffee Lake), 1 CPU, 12 logical and 6 physical cores
  [Host]     : .NET Framework 4.8 (4.8.4042.0), X64 RyuJIT
  DefaultJob : .NET Framework 4.8 (4.8.4042.0), X64 RyuJIT

```
| Method |     Mean |    Error |   StdDev | Gen 0 | Gen 1 | Gen 2 | Allocated | Allocated native memory | Native memory leak |
|------- |---------:|---------:|---------:|------:|------:|------:|----------:|------------------------:|-------------------:|
|    Run | 567.6 us | 11.03 us | 11.32 us |     - |     - |     - |     920 B |                 21730 B |                2 B |

Running with none of these providers:
```csharp
            //options.AppendExecutionProvider_CUDA(0);
            //options.AppendExecutionProvider_Tensorrt(0);
```
that is with default execution provider when built with cuda, cudnn, tensorrt support (I do not know which path/execution provider is used then). Then the native memory leak disappears. However, the execution time is way above our limits.

``` ini

BenchmarkDotNet=v0.12.0, OS=Windows 10.0.17763.864 (1809/October2018Update/Redstone5)
Intel Core i7-8700 CPU 3.20GHz (Coffee Lake), 1 CPU, 12 logical and 6 physical cores
  [Host]     : .NET Framework 4.8 (4.8.4042.0), X64 RyuJIT
  DefaultJob : .NET Framework 4.8 (4.8.4042.0), X64 RyuJIT


```
| Method |     Mean |     Error |    StdDev | Gen 0 | Gen 1 | Gen 2 | Allocated | Allocated native memory | Native memory leak |
|------- |---------:|----------:|----------:|------:|------:|------:|----------:|------------------------:|-------------------:|
|    Run | 2.598 ms | 0.0159 ms | 0.0149 ms |     - |     - |     - |     928 B |                 20638 B |                  - |

rename.from: Native memory leak in `Run` using TensorRT
rename.to: Native memory leak in `OrtRun` using TensorRT

body: Do you know which thread the test function "public float Run()" will be in? It's always the same thread or it could be a new thread created by the benchmark framework?
@snnn if you run a simple loop around the run this will still leak. And I am pretty sure this occurs on a single thread in BDN. No mattter what calling `OrtRun` repeatedly on a single thread leaks.

rename.from: Native memory leak in `OrtRun` using TensorRT
rename.to: Native memory leak in `OrtRun` using TensorRT and CUDA

issue.title: There might be memory leak in instanceNormalizationPlugin

repository.name: TensorRT
repository.description: NVIDIA® TensorRT™, an SDK for high-performance deep learning inference, includes a deep learning inference optimizer and runtime that delivers low latency and high throughput for inference applications.

issue.body:
There are two places that can cause leaks

First, every enqueue calls cudamalloc without releasing

https://github.com/NVIDIA/TensorRT/blob/572d54f91791448c015e74a4f1d6923b77b79795/plugin/instanceNormalizationPlugin/instanceNormalizationPlugin.cpp#L211


Second,  cudnn_handle will also be created every time

https://github.com/NVIDIA/TensorRT/blob/572d54f91791448c015e74a4f1d6923b77b79795/plugin/instanceNormalizationPlugin/instanceNormalizationPlugin.cpp#L217

body: CUDA isn't a real memory leak, it appears to be a false positive in BDNs NativeMemoryProfiler, probably due to some startup allocations .

rename.from: Native memory leak in `OrtRun` using TensorRT and CUDA
rename.to: Native memory leak in `OrtRun` using TensorRT

issue.title: Quick fix for memory leak in TensorRT

repository.name: onnxruntime
repository.description: ONNX Runtime: cross-platform, high performance ML inferencing and training accelerator

body:
@stevenlix it looks to me and I am not 100% sure but that the leak is in the lines:

https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/293b15480be468529cbd05e0c150fad23b08f186/onnxruntime/core/providers/tensorrt/tensorrt_execution_provider.cc#L523

https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/293b15480be468529cbd05e0c150fad23b08f186/onnxruntime/core/providers/tensorrt/tensorrt_execution_provider.cc#L679

which creates an optimization profile as a raw pointer:
```cpp
    virtual nvinfer1::IOptimizationProfile* createOptimizationProfile() noexcept = 0;
```
now the documentation says you must not delete this, since the `IBuilder` retains ownership, but it looks to me it was not intended that one creates one every time no matter if needed or not. 

At least basedon profiling using PerfView and a Debug build of onnxruntime together with the benchmark code detailed earlier one can see that this leaks memory for every time this is called.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10798831/72058662-c18c3880-32d0-11ea-9d4c-7295923fc2a0.png)

To fix this I changed the code to only create the optimization profile if needed in case of shape changes. This is a quick fix though, I think the handling of shape changes needs to be handled differently. We do not have shape changes so we can live with the quick fix. It's better than nothing.

The fix can be seen in #2805

After this fix BDN also shows there no longer is a native memory leak:

``` ini

BenchmarkDotNet=v0.12.0, OS=Windows 10.0.17763.864 (1809/October2018Update/Redstone5)
Intel Core i7-8700 CPU 3.20GHz (Coffee Lake), 1 CPU, 12 logical and 6 physical cores
  [Host]     : .NET Framework 4.8 (4.8.4042.0), X64 RyuJIT
  DefaultJob : .NET Framework 4.8 (4.8.4042.0), X64 RyuJIT


```
| Method |     Mean |   Error |   StdDev |   Median | Gen 0 | Gen 1 | Gen 2 | Allocated | Allocated native memory | Native memory leak |
|------- |---------:|--------:|---------:|---------:|------:|------:|------:|----------:|------------------------:|-------------------:|
|    Run | 417.3 us | 8.26 us | 21.16 us | 406.2 us |     - |     - |     - |     916 B |                  8490 B |                  - |

> @stevenlix it looks to me and I am not 100% sure but that the leak is in the lines:
> 
> https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/293b15480be468529cbd05e0c150fad23b08f186/onnxruntime/core/providers/tensorrt/tensorrt_execution_provider.cc#L523
> 
> https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/293b15480be468529cbd05e0c150fad23b08f186/onnxruntime/core/providers/tensorrt/tensorrt_execution_provider.cc#L679
> 
> which creates an optimization profile as a raw pointer:
> 
> ```c++
>     virtual nvinfer1::IOptimizationProfile* createOptimizationProfile() noexcept = 0;
> ```
> 
> now the documentation says you must not delete this, since the `IBuilder` retains ownership, but it looks to me it was not intended that one creates one every time no matter if needed or not.
> 
> At least basedon profiling using PerfView and a Debug build of onnxruntime together with the benchmark code detailed earlier one can see that this leaks memory for every time this is called.
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10798831/72058662-c18c3880-32d0-11ea-9d4c-7295923fc2a0.png)
> 
> To fix this I changed the code to only create the optimization profile if needed in case of shape changes. This is a quick fix though, I think the handling of shape changes needs to be handled differently. We do not have shape changes so we can live with the quick fix. It's better than nothing.
> 
> The fix can be seen in #2805


Thanks for debugging and root causing the issue!
I think we'll need to refactor the code to not always create an optimization profile.
probably we can just re-use the one initially created in TensorrtExecutionProvider::Compile()
and update it as needed.
@stevenlix is working on a fix and we'll probably ask you to help us validate it.
Thanks again!
@jywu-msft, after looking at the code, I think @nietras 's fix is good for now. Usually trt_profile is not needed in the compute unless shape range is changed, and it's better to keep it in local.

issue.title: Fix memory leak in TRT

repository.name: onnxruntime
repository.description: ONNX Runtime: cross-platform, high performance ML inferencing and training accelerator

issue.body:
1. Fixed memory leak issue, which is reported here,
https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/2773
Thank @nietras for the debugging and initial quick fix
2. Update conditions for optimization profile creation
3. Update return status
